resources.string: Gate Timing of switches or photoresistors
Visible timing display in real time

"
Changing the number of gates will delete previous timings from list.

OK to continue with change."

Calibration is required before timing can be performed. A gate can be a single switch or photoresistor.

Close all gates (illuminate all photoresistors), wait for calibration to finish.

To change the number of gates use menu item:
\nCalibration requires all gates closed (i.e. all photoresistors maximally illuminated).
Calibrating volume power level for gates.

Calibration and gate detection required.

To start, use menu item:

Please define the number of gates, then pass the object to be timed through each gate.

CANCEL to use last known gate level settings.

OK to start gate level detection.

&app_name; Version &versionCode;
measures the time gates
are entered and exited.

Menu choices are:
Time maximum wait for a gate

Please turn airplane mode settings ON manually. Phone calls, etc. interfere with timings.

CANCEL continues with Airplane mode OFF.

OK opens Setting > Airplane mode.
GateTiming failed to find gate circuit.

GateTiming requires gate circuit (see website) headset connection.

Cancel continues, no timings possible.

OK and connect gate circuit continues with timings.

&app_name; times objects moving through gates by the circuit at right connected to the headset as in the below photo. The circuit detects an object blocking illumination on the photoresistor; without the circuit, &app_name; has no functionality, no timing can be done.\n\nA complete description of the circuit and the &app_name; app can be found at the website listed at bottom.
Save current timings to CVS file, delete current timings, and continue.
GateTiming - Audio lost to another application.

Check that each photoresistor is connected and illuminated.


CANCEL to use last known calibration level.

OK to restart calibration.

Possible fixes:
a) Increase illumination at photoresistors,
b) Increase volume limit setting for media & music,
c) Match light wavelength to photoresistor.


CONTINUE to use this calibration level.

CANCEL to use last known calibration level.

OK to restart calibration.

Record Audio permission is required but now disabled.

Either manually enable by:

Settings > Apps > GateTiming > Permissions > Microphone

before opening &app_name; or uninstall &app_name; and reinstall.

&app_name; works by outputting audio through the timing circuit and recording the audio to detect changes when an object enters or exits a gate.\n\nAllow Record Audio is required for &app_name; to continue.
Allow &app_name; to access photos, media, and files on your device in order to save timing results to a CVS file.\n\nDeny and &app_name; will function without CVS file saving.

File Storage Access permission is now disabled.

Either manually enable by:

Settings > Apps > GateTiming > Permissions > Storage

before opening &app_name; or uninstall &app_name; and reinstall.

START to setup your device for &app_name;.

&app_name; times objects moving through gates by the circuit at right connected to the headset. This circuit is absolutely necessary.

A complete description of the circuit and the &app_name; app can be found at the website listed below.

For &app_name; to work, Setup needs to check the following:

CLOSE SETUP to continue &app_name; for these final steps.

1) Calibrate the circuit by automatic adjusting of the speaker volume to measure the illumination of all photoresistors (that gates are closed). All photoresistors in the circuit must be illuminated.

2) Test each gate individually to determine when gates have been entered or exited.

Setup final status:
&app_name; is not allowed to access files on your device.

RETRY after connecting headset circuit.

IGNORE will continue but no timings possible.

&app_name; times objects moving through gates by the circuit at right connected to the headset as in the below photo. The circuit detects an object blocking illumination on the photoresistor; without the circuit, &app_name; has no functionality, no timing can be done.

A complete description of the circuit and the &app_name; app can be found at the website listed at bottom.

Airplane mode should be ON to avoid interference with timings by phone calls, etc.

RETRY to turn Airplane Mode ON.

IGNORE will continue with Airplane Mode OFF.

&app_name; works by outputting audio through the timing circuit at right and recording the audio to detect changes when an object enters or exits a gate.

RETRY to Allow Record Audio.

IGNORE or Deny permission and &app_name; will be unable to function.
RETRY to Allow Access for &app_name; to access photos, media, and files on your device in order to save timing results to a CVS file.\n\nIGNORE and &app_name; will function without CVS file saving.
RETRY after correcting gate\nillumination with Poor or Fail rating.
RETRY after connecting circuit - appears to be disconnected.
